cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest to north, expected to track inland across eastern North Carolina Saturday, then northward through the Chesapeake Bay region and off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina coast (likely between Cape Lookout and Cape Fear)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Surf City NC to Duck NC; Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point; Tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach; remainder of the Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE; Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach; Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds; Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island.  Storm-Surge Warning: Duck NC to Chincoteague VA, Chesapeake Bay south of Windmill Point, Neuse & Pamlico rivers, portions of Albemarle & Pamlico sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. through the Mid-Atlantic coast from South Carolina to New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeasterly winds 25–35 mph with low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft water rise possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay, leading to minor coastal flooding around Baltimore
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain expected Saturday night through Sunday with isolated higher totals, creating urban and small-stream flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the Atlantic beaches; slight tornado risk late Saturday into Sunday across the Mid-Atlantic
